alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 10:09PM EDT until July 30 at 5:36AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. Kentucky River near Ravenna affecting Estill County. Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Water enters the basement of a home off of Highway 30 on the right bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 33.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Thursday was 33.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.3 feet on 04/13/1972. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued 3 AM EDT.
